parameters.name: object
parameters.help: Target object will be affected by this tween.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Current game instance.

parameters.name: manager
parameters.help: The TweenManager responsible for looking after this Tween.

public.name: chain
public.help: You can chain tweens together by passing a reference to the chain function. This enables one tween to call another on completion.\nYou can pass as many tweens as you like to this function, they will each be chained in sequence.

public.name: delay
public.help: Sets a delay time before this tween will start.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount of the delay in ms.

public.name: easing
public.help: Set easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.

parameters.name: easing
parameters.help: The easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.

public.name: from
public.help: Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween starts at the given value and tweens to the current values.\nFor example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened from `x: 200` by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.help: Properties you want to tween from.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: Duration of this tween in ms.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.help: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.

parameters.name: autoStart
parameters.help: Whether this tween will start automatically or not.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.help: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.help: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as Number.MAX_VALUE. This ignores any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.help: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

public.name: generateData
public.help: This will generate an array populated with the tweened object values from start to end.\nIt works by running the tween simulation at the given frame rate based on the values set-up in Tween.to and similar functions.\nIt ignores delay and repeat counts and any chained tweens. Just one play through of tween data is returned, including yoyo if set.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.help: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.

parameters.name: data
parameters.help: If given the generated data will be appended to this array, otherwise a new array will be returned.

public.name: interpolation
public.help: Set interpolation function the tween will use, by default it uses Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation.\nAlso available: Phaser.Math.bezierInterpolation and Phaser.Math.catmullRomInterpolation.

parameters.name: interpolation
parameters.help: The interpolation function to use (Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation by default)

public.name: loop
public.help:
Loop a chain of tweens

Usage:
game.add.tween(p).to({ x: 700 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None, true)
.to({ y: 300 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.to({ x: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.to({ y: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.loop();

public.name: onUpdateCallback
public.help: Sets a callback to be fired each time this tween updates.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The callback to invoke each time this tween is updated.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which to call the onUpdate callback.

public.name: repeat
public.help: Sets the number of times this tween will repeat.

parameters.name: times
parameters.help: How many times to repeat.

public.name: start
public.help: Starts the tween running. Can also be called by the autoStart parameter of Tween.to.

public.name: stop
public.help: Stops the tween if running and removes it from the TweenManager. If there are any onComplete callbacks or events they are not dispatched.

public.name: to
public.help: Sets this tween to be a `to` tween on the properties given. A `to` tween starts at the current value and tweens to the destination value given.\nFor example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened to `x` 200 by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.help: The properties you want to tween, such as `Sprite.x` or `Sound.volume`. Given as a JavaScript object.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: Duration of this tween in ms.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.help: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Default, which is Phaser.Easing.Linear.None by default but can be over-ridden at will.

parameters.name: autoStart
parameters.help: Whether this tween will start automatically or not.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.help: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.help: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as Number.MAX_VALUE. This ignores any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.help: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

public.name: update

returns.help: false if the tween has completed and should be deleted from the manager, otherwise true (still active).

public.help: Core tween update function called by the TweenManager. Does not need to be invoked directly.

parameters.name: time
parameters.help: A timestamp passed in by the TweenManager.

public.name: yoyo
public.help: A tween that has yoyo set to true will run through from start to finish, then reverse from finish to start.\nUsed in combination with repeat you can create endless loops.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.help: Set to true to yoyo this tween.

private.name: _pause
private.help: This is called by the core Game loop. Do not call it directly, instead use Tween.pause.

private.name: _resume
private.help: This is called by the core Game loop. Do not call it directly, instead use Tween.pause.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: isRunning
public.inlineHelp: If the tween is running this is set to true, otherwise false. Tweens that are in a delayed state, waiting to start, are considered as being running.

public.name: onComplete
public.inlineHelp: The onComplete event is fired when the Tween completes. Does not fire if the Tween is set to loop.

public.name: onLoop
public.inlineHelp: The onLoop event is fired if the Tween loops.

public.name: onStart
public.inlineHelp: The onStart event is fired when the Tween begins.

public.name: pendingDelete
public.inlineHelp: If this tween is ready to be deleted by the TweenManager.

private.name: _chainedTweens
private.inlineHelp: A private array of chained tweens.

private.name: _codePaused
private.inlineHelp: Was the Tween paused by code or by Game focus loss?

private.name: _easingFunction
private.inlineHelp: The easing function used for the tween.

private.name: _interpolationFunction
private.inlineHelp: The interpolation function used for the tween.

private.name: _onUpdateCallbackContext
private.inlineHelp: The context in which to call the onUpdate callback.

private.name: _paused
private.inlineHelp: Is this Tween paused or not?
